kpis.name: Total Revenue
kpis.description: Sum of sales across all transactions
kpis.reason: Revenue is a critical measure of sales performance, reflecting the overall business growth and success. It is essential for understanding the financial health of the e-commerce operations.

kpis.name: Average Order Value
kpis.reason: This KPI helps in understanding customer spending behavior and is crucial for assessing the effectiveness of pricing strategies and promotions.

kpis.name: Customer Count
kpis.reason: Tracking the number of unique customers provides insights into the customer base size and growth, which is vital for customer relationship management and marketing strategies.

charts.name: Revenue Over Time
charts.description: Shows total revenue trends over time
charts.reason: Visualizing revenue over time helps identify trends, seasonality, and anomalies, aiding in strategic planning and performance evaluation.

charts.name: Top Selling Products
charts.description: Displays the most sold products by quantity
charts.reason: Identifying top-selling products is crucial for inventory management, marketing focus, and understanding customer preferences.

charts.name: Sales by Country
charts.description: Distribution of sales revenue by country
charts.reason: Understanding sales distribution by country helps in tailoring marketing strategies and identifying potential markets for expansion.

charts.name: Order Quantity Distribution
charts.reason: Analyzing order quantity distribution helps in understanding purchasing patterns and optimizing inventory levels.

charts.name: Customer Purchase Frequency
charts.reason: This chart provides insights into customer loyalty and engagement, which are key for retention strategies and personalized marketing.
